title: Crypto tycoon Sam Bankman-Fried found guilty on all counts at fraud trial
summary: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried’s spectacular rise and fall in the cryptocurrency industry hit rock bottom Thursday when a New York jury convicted him of fraud in a scheme that cheated customers and investors of at least $10 billion.

title: Striking Hamas amid civilians: The Israeli army's impossible strategy in Gaza
summary: The Israeli army justified its strikes on the Jabalia camp in the north of the enclave, which caused numerous civilian casualties, by insisting on the destruction of an underground Hamas command post.

title: In a West Bank town, the Israeli army confines Palestinians to their homes: 'We're in a prison and it's liable to explode'
summary: Restrictions on movement have been imposed on the population of Huwara since Hamas's terrorist attack. Beyond the current conflict, this extreme situation is the culmination of years of confrontation with settlers.

title: 'The sale of Rafales to Saudi Arabia would be a success by default for French aircraft in the ruthless arms business'
summary: Saudi Arabia is considering purchasing 54 aircraft from Dassault Aviation after a German veto blocked its purchase of 48 Typhoon jets due to human rights concerns, as reported by economic journalist Jean-Michel Bezat of 'Le Monde.'

title: Storm Ciaran wreaks havoc across Western Europe killing at least seven people
summary: Storm Ciaran swept through the continent Thursday with record-breaking winds in France and leaving millions facing power outages and travel disruption.

title: World Cup 2034: Football players remain completely silent on human rights violations in Saudi Arabia
summary: The monarchy has attracted a host of stars to its league and now looks set to host the 2034 World Cup. At the heart of this powerful sporting soft power movement, players and governing bodies never express views on the kingdom's politics.

title: At the Rafah crossing between Egypt and Gaza, 'people were fighting to get through'
summary: The first evacuation of wounded people, dual nationals and foreigners from the enclave proved chaotic. Cairo is calling for more humanitarian aid for the Palestinian population trapped under Israeli bombardment.

title: China pays tribute to former Prime Minister Li Keqiang, 'the last leader of the reform era'
summary: Li Keqiang, prime minister until March, was laid to rest on Thursday, a week after his death from a heart attack. His career was characterized by the diminishing of his influence as China's top leader, Xi Jinping, consolidated power.

title: Apollo astronaut Thomas Mattingly dies at 87
summary: The American astronaut formerly part of the Apollo 13 mission played a vital role in ensuring the safe return of its crew through his ground control problem-solving efforts.

title: Footage of Storm Ciaran's impact on western France
summary: Record wind gusts of over 200 km/h were recorded in western France, causing many trees to fall onto the roads.

title: Trump sons, Donald Jr and Eric, testify in civil fraud trial
summary: The former US president's two eldest sons are executive vice presidents of the Trump Organization, which is accused of fraudulently inflating the value of its assets.

title: Sweden wants people to stop confusing it with Switzerland
summary: After a slip-up by Joe Biden, the Swedish tourist board has launched a humorous campaign to highlight the differences between the two countries and repair the country's tarnished image.

title: Pakistan, in crisis, pushes elections back to February 8
summary: As Pakistan has been in political chaos since 2022, as well as economic and security issues, its Election commission has 'unanimously decided' to postpone the elections.

title: Putin revokes Russia's ratification of nuclear test ban treaty
summary: The Russian president signed a law withdrawing Russia's ratification of the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty, which has never come into force as China, the US and 6 others never ratified it.

title: Storm Ciaran: A night of destruction and howling gales in Brittany
summary: Faced with violent winds and falling branches, all traffic was banned on the roads in Finistère, the western tip of Brittany.

title: US warns Sudanese paramilitaries against 'imminent, large-scale attack'
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken personally called on Sudan's warring parties, the army and Rapid Support Forces paramilitaries, to 'immediately cease further attacks'.

title: US sanctions UAE, Turkish, and Chinese entities aiding Russian 'war machine'
summary: The US Treasury, State and Commerce Department sanctions target hundreds of 'willing third-country individuals and entities' that Russia uses 'to resupply its military'.

title: 'Carbon bombs': Explore the map of the world's biggest fossil fuel expansion projects
summary: Oil, gas, coal: 422 extraction sites alone are ruining the chances of limiting global warming to 1.5°C. An original map drawn up by two French NGOs has lifted the veil on the companies involved in these projects.
